016package app.supernaut.fx;
017
018import app.supernaut.BackgroundApp;
019import javafx.application.Application;
020
021import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
022import java.util.ServiceLoader;
023import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
024
025/**
026 * Launcher for Supernaut.FX (JavaFX) applications. By using this launcher, your applications
027 * can <i>implement</i> the {@link ApplicationDelegate} interface instead of <i>extending</i>
028 * {@link Application} and have their constructor dependency injected -- see {@link ApplicationDelegate} for
029 * an explanation of the advantages and details of this approach.
030 */
031public interface FxLauncher {
032    /**
033     * Launch and run the application on the current thread.
034     * Does not return until after foreground app closes.
035     * @param args command-line args
036     * @param foregroundApp class object for ForegroundApp
037     * @param backgroundApp class object for BackgroundApp
038     */
039    void launch(String[] args, Class<? extends ApplicationDelegate> foregroundApp, Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundApp);
040
041    /**
042     * Launch and run the application on the current thread. Uses default/no-op background application.
043     * Does not return until after foreground app closes.
044     * @param args command-line args
045     * @param foregroundApp class object for ForegroundApp
046     */
047    void launch(String[] args, Class<? extends ApplicationDelegate> foregroundApp);
048
049    /**
050     * Launch and run the application on a newly created thread.
051     * This method is useful for testing and possibly for other
052     * application startup scenarios.
053     *
054     * @param args command-line args
055     * @param foregroundApp class object for ForegroundApp
056     * @param backgroundApp class object for BackgroundApp
057     * @return A future that is completed when Foreground app is initialized
058     */
059    CompletableFuture<ApplicationDelegate> launchAsync(String[] args, Class<? extends ApplicationDelegate> foregroundApp, Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundApp);
060
061    /**
062     * Get a future that will be completed when the Foreground app
063     * is initialized.
064     *
065     * @return A future that is completed when Foreground app is initialized
066     */
067    CompletableFuture<ApplicationDelegate> getForegroundApp();
068
069    /**
070     * Get a future that will be completed when the Background app
071     * is initialized.
072     *
073     * @return A future that is completed when Background app is initialized
074     */
075    CompletableFuture<BackgroundApp> getBackgroundApp();
076
077    /**
078     * Construct a {@link ApplicationDelegate} that is a delegate to {@code OpenJfxProxyApplication}.
079     * @param jfxApplication The OpenJfx "proxy" app instance
080     * @return A newly constructed (and possibly injected) foreground app
081     */
082    ApplicationDelegate createForegroundApp(Application jfxApplication);
083
084    /**
085     * Implementations must implement this method to return a unique name
086     * @return A unique name for this DI-capable {@link FxLauncher} implementation
087     */
088    String name();
089
090    /**
091     * Find a FxLauncher provider by name
092     *
093     * @param name Name (e.g. "micronaut")
094     * @return an FxLaunder instance
095     * @throws NoSuchElementException if not found
096     */
097    static FxLauncher byName(String name) {
098        ServiceLoader<FxLauncher> loaders = ServiceLoader.load(FxLauncher.class);
099        return loaders.stream()
100                .map(ServiceLoader.Provider::get)
101                .filter(launcher -> launcher.name().equals(name))
102                .findFirst()
103                .orElseThrow(() -> new NoSuchElementException("Launcher '" + name + "' not found."));
104    }
105}
